summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice foreign travel questionnaire for an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York traveling from February 3-6, 2020. The purpose is to interview and debrief a witness in the ongoing, sensitive investigation of Jeffrey Epstein, with Ghislaine Maxwell identified as a subject.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the investigation referenced in the travel questionnaire (case: In re Jeffrey Epstein).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a subject of the same investigation, believed to be a citizen of the U.S., U.K., and France.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects in the same ongoing, sensitive investigation referenced in the travel authorization.

events.title: Planned foreign travel for investigation
events.description: An AUSA from SDNY departs for foreign travel to interview and debrief a witness in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

events.title: Return from foreign travel
events.description: Planned return date for the AUSA traveling on the Epstein investigation matter.

locations: USAO-SDNY (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The document is a foreign travel authorization form for an Assistant U.S. Attorney from SDNY traveling from February 3-6, 2020.
The travel's purpose is to interview and debrief a witness in the ongoing investigation 'In re Jeffrey Epstein' (USAO # 2018R01618).
The investigation is described as 'ongoing and very sensitive.'
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly named as a subject of the investigation, with noted multiple citizenships (U.S., U.K., France).
Foreign authorities have cleared the visit and are prepared to cooperate, indicating international coordination in the Epstein investigation.
